page.title: 11Languages in Leeswood area
page.content: The use of the Welsh language in the Leeswood area is in decline.Older residents tell us that in the early 20th century,Welsh was the most popular language in the home and the chapels, even though it was not taught in schools. Today less than half the population can speak Welsh,even though it is taught in schools. The reasons for this are thought to include the decline in Sunday School attendance,the influx of many English people into the area,and the influence of the English language media,espec- ially television.
